results.title: Conduction in P and N crystals
results.brief_description: Part two of the Semiconductor Physics series demonstrates how an extra free electron is introduced into a germanium crystal. One of the atoms having four valency electrons is replaced by a foreign atom having five valency electrons, such as an atom of antimony.

results.title: Condom sense
results.creator_credit: Steve Faigenbaum, Jim Locker and Cerberus Productions
results.brief_description: A very original, informative film aimed at encouraging men to take a more active role in contraception. Using comedy to dispel the myths and complaints associated with condom use, the film presents accurate information about birth control and opens up the issues of communication and responsibility in relationships.

results.title: Computer history digest: a chronicle of important events...
results.creator_credit: George Samson and Association for computing machinery
results.brief_description: Provides a brief historical overview of computers, with a focus on US achievements. Discusses punch card technology and the flexibility of plug boards. Shows the 1939 Worlds Fair showcasing future calculating devices and the ENIAC, designed by Eckert and Mauchly to compute World War II ballistic firing tables. Includes early 20th century footage of computers.

results.title: Competitive swimming: starts, turns, stroke drills
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct form for all swimming starts - grab start for freestyle, breaststroke and butterfly; correct entry for freestyle, butterfly and breaststroke; relay starts and the backstroke start for both long and short courses. Illustrates all turns, using slow motion and underwater camera, and also shows progressive drills for all strokes.

results.title: Competitive diving : Basic diving skills
results.brief_description: Covers basic skills of springboard and tower diving - approaches, take-offs, and basic dive positions (tuck, pike, straight and entry). No other credits available.

results.title: Communism
results.brief_description: An example of a propaganda film made in the United States in the early 1950’s informing the viewer of the evils of communism and how to detect those with communist beliefs. Includes historical footage.

results.title: Communication and motivation: dealing successfully with today's students
results.brief_description: One of a series in which Dr William Glasser presents a problem solving approach for individuals in therapeutic situations and which can be applied to discipline in schools. Glasser combines his discussion of the Schools Without Failure concepts, and examines the ways in which motivation can be encouraged - laughter and fun, and the importance of self expression give a child recognition that will motivate him to work. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.
